column1: Guane is a municipality and town in the Pinar del Río Province of Cuba. It was founded in 1602.
The municipality is divided into the barrios of Cabo de San Antonio y La Fe
Guane is a Cuban Indigenous name. Before it was renamed Pinar del Río in 1774
column2: the area was known as the old colonial capital of Guane.

column1: It was the main city of Filipino migrants to Cuba
column2: who were known as Chinos Manila among the local population. The Filipinos worked the huge tobacco plantations much as they did in their home country
column3: in the present provinces of Ilocos Sur
column6: Cagayan and Isabela.  During that time
column7: the Spanish colonizers had a virtual monopoly of the tobacco trade through their company
